segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor is getting bigger, and she’s standing right in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress is going to get soaked, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s lost in thought or just really focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the edge like a tiny waterfall, and she’s just ignoring it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids behind her are up to no good, but she’s completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is going to end badly if someone doesn’t do something soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I should probably say something, but I don’t want to startle her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
